ingredients: 3/4 cup all-purpose flour (use gluten-free if needed)
1 1/2 cups rolled oats (use gluten-free if needed)
steps: Preheat oven to 350F (180C). Line baking tray with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine coconut sugar, sugar, maple syrup, coconut oil, applesauce, and vanilla. Mix until fully combined.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt to wet ingredients and mix well.
Fold in oats and chocolate chips until just combined. Avoid overmixing to prevent spreading.
Using a cookie scoop, drop dough balls onto lined trays, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake 15 minutes until edges begin turning golden. Do not over-bake, as cookies continue to cook as they cool down.
Cool on tray for 10 minutes before transferring to wire rack.
title: Healthy Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
